skill.name: fluidsim
skill.description: Framework for computational fluid dynamics simulations using Python. Use when running fluid dynamics simulations including Navier-Stokes equations (2D/3D), shallow water equations, stratified flows, or when analyzing turbulence, vortex dynamics, or geophysical flows. Provides pseudospectral methods with FFT, HPC support, and comprehensive output analysis.

content.user_title: Run CFD simulations with pseudospectral methods
content.value_statement: Computational fluid dynamics simulations require complex physics knowledge and specialized software. FluidSim provides a Python framework for solving Navier-Stokes equations with high-performance pseudospectral methods and FFT, enabling accurate turbulence and vortex dynamics research.
actual_capabilities: Solve 2D and 3D Navier-Stokes equations with pseudospectral methods
Simulate stratified flows and shallow water equations for geophysical applications
Configure viscosity, time stepping, and initial conditions via Python API
Save and analyze physical fields, spatial means, and energy spectra
Run MPI parallel simulations on multiple processors
Perform parametric studies with varying physical parameters
limitations: Requires Python 3.9 or higher and FFT libraries for pseudospectral methods
Simulations run on periodic domains only (no general boundary conditions)
No built-in visualization for 3D fields beyond HDF5 export to ParaView
MPI installation requires local compilation of mpi4py

best_practices: Use powers of 2 for grid resolution (128, 256, 512, 1024) to optimize FFT performance
Enable CFL-adaptive time stepping with CFL=0.5 for stable simulations
Set appropriate output periods to balance data storage and temporal resolution
anti_patterns: Using resolutions not divisible by powers of 2, which degrades FFT performance
Disabling all output types, losing valuable diagnostic information
Running long simulations without checkpointing or field saves

faq.question: Which solver should I use for 3D turbulence?
faq.answer: Use ns3d solver for 3D Navier-Stokes simulations. It supports full 3D turbulence dynamics and MPI parallelization for high-resolution simulations.

faq.question: What is the maximum grid size supported?
faq.answer: Grid size depends on available memory. 512Ã—512Ã—512 typically requires 16-32 GB RAM. Use MPI to distribute larger simulations across multiple processors.

faq.question: How do I restart an interrupted simulation?
faq.answer: Set params.init_fields.type = 'from_file' and specify the path to a saved state file. Set a new t_end to continue the simulation from that point.

faq.question: Is my simulation data safe?
faq.answer: FluidSim saves data locally to the specified output directory. No data is transmitted externally. Set FLUIDSIM_PATH to control where files are saved.

faq.question: Why is my simulation running slowly?
faq.answer: Check your FFT library selection (pyfftw is faster than numpy fft), increase grid resolution to powers of 2, enable MPI for parallel processing, and reduce output frequency.

faq.question: How does FluidSim compare to OpenFOAM?
faq.answer: FluidSim uses pseudospectral methods for higher accuracy on periodic domains, while OpenFOAM uses finite volume for general geometries. FluidSim is ideal for fundamental turbulence research.
